page.title: 13TOWPATH WALK CONTINUED
page.content: STILE WHICH LEADS DOWN TO THE TOWPATH. UNDER THE BRIDGE WE NOTICED THE MARKS MADE BY THE WIRE TOW-ROPES IN IRON STAYS WHICH PROTECT THE BRICKWORK.TURN SOUTHWARDS AND WE SEE THAT THERE ARE MOORINGS AVAILABLE BY THE INN AS WELL AS ON THE TOWPATH SIDE. AS YOU MAKE YOUR WAY ALONG THE TOWPATH LOOK FOR HE FIRST GAP IN THE HAWTHORN HEDGE.UNTIL ABOUT 30 YEARS AGO THERE WAS A MILK WHARF HERE MADE OF OLD RAIL WAY SLEEPERS.EACH DAY MILK WAS COLLECT- ED AND TAKEN TO WOLVERHAMPTON.FURTHER ON,WHERE THE CANAL GETS WIDER, THERE WAS A COAL WHARF.BOATS CAN STILL BE TURNED ROUND HERE.NEXT WE COME TO THE WAREHOUSE.THE AREA OUTSIDE THE WARE- HOUSE WAS USED TO DUMP STONE AND SLAG FOR THE REPAIR OF VILLAGE ROADS.THE WAREHOUSE ITSELF WAS USED TO STORE GRAIN FOR THE LOCAL FARMERS BEFORE BOATS CARRIED THE SACKS TO THE MILL.
